title: Introduction to simK
text: package 3 main functions, can generate simulated data pool donors, set kidney transplant candidates respective HLA-antibodies patients HLA sensitized.

title: Introduction to simK
text: data frame information pool simulated donors can generated function donors_df(): given number rows n, data frame generated columns: ID unique identifier prefix â€˜Dâ€™; bg blood group generated parameter probs vector probabilities groups , AB, B O, respectively; A1, A2, B1, B2, DR1, DR2 HLA typing obtained according origin option (replace = TRUE can generate data frame without limitations number rows); age generated Normal distribution mean sd given user, values truncated lower upper boundaries; DRI option uk = TRUE, Donor Risk Index copmputed described transplantr HLA population origin currently valid options â€˜PTâ€™ Portuguese, populations available US National Marrow Donor Program: â€˜APIâ€™ - Asian / Pacific Islander â€˜AFAâ€™ - African American / Black â€˜CAUâ€™ - White / Caucasian â€˜â€™ - Hispanic Defining n_seed allows reproducibility. :information_source: compute DRI decribed transplantr, generated variables: height (\(N(165,20)\)); hypertension (probability \(0.43\)); sex (probability \(0.55\) man); CMV+ (probability \(0.9\)); hospital stay (\(P(\lambda = 4)\)); GFR age (<30 \(N(116,10)\); 30-39 \(N(107,10)\); 40-49 \(N(99,10)\); 50-59 \(N(93,10)\); 60-69 \(N(85, 10)\); >=70 \(N(75, 10)\))

title: Introduction to simK
text: simulated waiting list kidney transplant candidates, can generated candidates_df(): given number n rows, data frame generated columns: ID unique identifier prefix â€˜Kâ€™; bg blood group generated parameter probs_abo vector probabilities groups , AB, B O, respectively (default, assumed group O patients frequent); A1, A2, B1, B2, DR1, DR2 HLA typing obtained according origin option (replace = TRUE can generate data frame without limitations number rows); age generated Normal distribution mean sd given user, values truncated lower upper boundaries; dialysis time dialysis months, values computed according patientsâ€™ blood group hypersensitation status (cPRA > 85%): patients blood group O Hypersinsitized time dialysis obtained N(85, 20); patients blood O Hypersinsitized \(N(70,20)\); remaining patients time dialysis obtained \(N(35,20)\); cPRA patients classified groups probabilities given probs_cpra 0%, 1%-50%, 51%-85% 86%-100%, respectively. Within groups > 0%, cPRA computed random values distributions \(P(\lambda = 30)\), \(P(\lambda = 70)\) \(P(\lambda = 90)\); Tier patients classified two Tiers described POL186/11 â€“ Kidney Transplantation: Deceased Donor Organ Allocation UK transplant. Tier patients MS = 10 cPRA = 100% time dialysis > 7 years, remaing patients classified Tier B; MS matchabilily score deciles obtained number donors dataset D10K match transplant candidate. score takes account patientâ€™s blood type, HLA type cPRA value. patient MS = 1 defined easy match MS = 10 difficult match. RRI option uk = TRUE, Recipient Risk Index copmputed described transplantr. compute RRI, variables age, time dialysis (days) probability diabetic (obtained prob_dm) used. Also, assumed patients dialysis time listing. HLA population origin can defined options: â€˜PTâ€™,â€˜APIâ€™,â€˜AFAâ€™,â€˜CAUâ€™ â€˜â€™, reported donors_df() data frame. Defining n_seed allows reproducibility.

title: Introduction to simK
text: function Abs_df() allows generate data frame HLA antibodies candidates waiting list: inputs, function requires data set ID patients HLA information (HLA typing cPRA value) format provided candidates_df(). Defining n_seed allows reproducibility. HLA population origin must defined accordance functions candidates_df(). PT origin, functions rely HLA typing intermediate resolution described Lima et al, 2013. NMDP populations, HLA typing described Gragert et al, 2013
code: Abs_df(candidates = candidates_df(n=10),        origin = 'PT',        n_seed = 3) #> # A tibble: 49 x 2 #>    ID    abs   #>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 K3    A25   #>  2 K3    DR4   #>  3 K8    A25   #>  4 K8    DR16  #>  5 K8    A33   #>  6 K8    B51   #>  7 K8    B48   #>  8 K8    DR16  #>  9 K8    B52   #> 10 K8    B55   #> # ... with 39 more rows

text: License: Creative Commons Attribution CC-. Feel free share adapt, donâ€™t forget credit author. ðŸ˜Ž ðŸŽ¯ Functions procedurally generate synthetic data R kidney transplant simulations. can see simK action, . simK allows generate data clinical demographic information pool simulated cadaveric donors simulated wait listed candidates kidney transplantation. Data generated simK particularly useful KARS. âš ï¸ package medical device used making clinical decisions.

title: A data frame with donors characteristics â€” candidates_df
code: candidates_df(   n = 10,   replace = TRUE,   origin = "PT",   probs_abo = c(0.43, 0.03, 0.08, 0.46),   probs_cpra = c(0.7, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1),   lower = 18,   upper = 75,   mean = 45,   sd = 15,   prob_dm = 0.12,   uk = FALSE,   n_seed = 3 )

title: A data frame with donors characteristics â€” candidates_df
text: n integer define number rows replace logical value sampling replacement origin character value population origin options: 'PT', 'API', 'AFA', 'CAU' '' probs_abo vector probabilities blood group , AB, B O (order). sum probabilities must equal one. probs_cpra vector probabilities cPRA groups 0%, 1%-50%, 51%-84%, 85%-100% (order). sum probabilities must equal one. lower integer ages' lower limit. upper integer ages' upper limit. mean value mean age's distribution. sd value standard deviation age's distribution. prob_dm value probability Diabetes Mellitus uk logical value, TRUE also computed Donor Risk Index (DRI) n_seed numeric seed used random number generation.

title: A data frame with donors characteristics â€” candidates_df
text: data frame HLA typing, blood group, truncated ages, time dialysis (months), cPRA, Tier, MS RRI (last 3, uk = TRUE) simulated group transplant candidates.

title: A data frame with donors characteristics â€” candidates_df
code: candidates_df(n = 10, replace = TRUE, origin = 'PT', probs_abo = c(0.43, 0.03, 0.08, 0.46), probs_cpra = c(0.7, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1), lower=18, upper=75, mean = 45, sd = 15, prob_dm = 0.12, uk = FALSE, n_seed = 3) #> # A tibble: 10 x 12 #>    ID    bg       A1    A2    B1    B2   DR1   DR2   age  cPRA hiper dialysis #>    <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <lgl>    <dbl> #>  1 K1    A         1    29     8    44    11     7    36     0 FALSE       49 #>  2 K2    O         2     3     7    57     4     8    21     0 FALSE       22 #>  3 K3    A        11    33    14    35     1    13    26    21 FALSE       55 #>  4 K4    O        24    30    49    58    11    11    37     0 FALSE       98 #>  5 K5    O         2     3     7    51     1    13    47     0 FALSE       89 #>  6 K6    A        30    68    15    18     3     4    25     0 FALSE       22 #>  7 K7    O         3    26    18    40    11    13    56     0 FALSE       79 #>  8 K8    A         1     1     7     8     3    13    72    90 TRUE        81 #>  9 K9    O         3     3     7    44    15     8    47    60 FALSE       65 #> 10 K10   O        11    29    44    57     7     7    30     0 FALSE       42

Matchability from D10K â€” matchability
text: Computes number donors dataset D10K match given transplant candidate. sample D10K selected according cPRA value, donors ABO identical HLA mismatch level 1 2 (0 DR (1 DR 0 B)) filtered.

title: Matchability from D10K â€” matchability
code: matchability(   cABO = "A",   cPRA = 85,   cA = c("2", "29"),   cB = c("7", "15"),   cDR = c("4", "7"),   n_seed = 3 )

title: Matchability from D10K â€” matchability
text: cABO character '', 'B', 'AB', 'O' cPRA candidate's cPRA value cA candidate's HLA-typing cB candidate's HLA-B typing cDR candidate's HLA-DR typing n_seed numeric seed used random number generation.

title: Matchability from D10K â€” matchability
text: Match Score measure difficult match patient organ donor. score 1 (easy match) 10 (difficult match).

title: Matchability from D10K â€” matchability
